message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: I’m planning to apply for full-time Master’s programs in civil engineering starting in 2026. Could you help me find the minimum GPA requirements for admission to Ivy League institutions in the US and Group of Eight universities in Australia?

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following columns: Country, University, Alliance, and Minimum GPA Requirement.

Note: 
The value of “Alliance” can only be “Ivy League” or “Group of Eight”
If no specified minimum GPA cutoff in official resources, list as "no minimum GPA specified"

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the column without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

To find the minimum GPA requirements for admission to Ivy League institutions in the US and Group of Eight universities in Australia, I will need to search each country's respective institutions.

<search>minimum GPA requirements for admission to Ivy League institutions in the US</search>

Search query: minimum GPA requirements for admission to Ivy League institutions in the US
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.reddit.com/r/ApplyingToCollege/comments/1ks7jeo/realistic_criteria_for_an_ivy/):
Realistic Criteria for an Ivy : r/ApplyingToCollege unweighted GPA at least 3.7, but closer to 4.0 is better. in the top 10% of your class, ideally top 2%. maximum academic rigor ...

[Doc 2](https://www.quadeducationgroup.com/blog/ivy-league-gpa-requirements-everything-you-need-to-know):
Ivy League GPA Requirements: Avg. Grades + Your Chances A good GPA for Ivy League schools is between 3.9 and 4.0. There are eight Ivy League schools, as shown in the following table.

[Doc 3](https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-minimum-GPA-required-for-admission-into-an-Ivy-League-university-How-many-applicants-do-Ivy-League-universities-typically-receive):
What is the minimum GPA required for admission into an ... There's no minimum required unweighted GPA to get into the Ivy League. I've seen students with perfect 1600 (or 2400) SAT scores and 4.0 GPA's ...
